citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Approximately one week ago, the licensee discovered that one of their domestic ducks had lost some feathers and was
starting to exhibit lameness. The licensee separated this duck from the other ducks and waterfowl, placing it in a different
enclosure. According to the licensee, there has been no significant improvement in this animal’s condition since
separating it from the other birds and the attending veterinarian has not yet been contacted regarding this animal. At the
time of the inspection, the duck was still noticeably lame and missing some of its feathers. Lameness may indicate an
underlying medical condition that requires diagnosis and treatment by a licensed veterinarian.
Accurate daily observation of the animals and direct frequent communication with the veterinarian to obtain guidance on
the care and treatment of health problems is necessary to ensure animal health and well-being. The licensee must ensure
that all animals are observed for health issues daily and that the veterinarian is consulted promptly about problems. To be
corrected by August 15, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Approximately one week ago, the licensee discovered that one of their domestic ducks had lost some feathers and was 
starting to exhibit lameness. The licensee separated this duck from the other ducks and waterfowl, placing it in a different 
enclosure. According to the licensee, there has been no significant improvement in this animal’s condition since 
separating it from the other birds and the attending veterinarian has not yet been contacted regarding this animal. At the 
time of the inspection, the duck was still noticeably lame and missing some of its feathers. Lameness may indicate an 
underlying medical condition that requires diagnosis and treatment by a licensed veterinarian.  
 
Accurate daily observation of the animals and direct frequent communication with the veterinarian to obtain guidance on 
the care and treatment of health problems is necessary to ensure animal health and well-being. The licensee must ensure 
that all animals are observed for health issues daily and that the veterinarian is consulted promptly about problems. To be 
corrected by August 15, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
